Text: Re FERC Data Warehouseall Hope this clarifies We are currently collating needs data from our interview cycle Preliminarily the interviews confirm our suspicions Cost PL reporting is the most widely held concern Cash flow reporting treasury direct indirect follows closely There is no easy readily available solution to FERC reporting People have lost ad hoc query functionality with the implementation of SAP Project Sunrises reporting charter will be to address these needs in the most efficient cost effective way possible That could be through a data warehouse could be through the FERC SAP module could be through another avenue None of us has the answer to the methodology question yet although we all have ideas I would prefer to keep the Project Sunrise team focused on the task at hand sifting through the interview information and developing a work plan We have followup interviews to schedule complete a data model to build etc Basically a lot of work on our plates However FERC reporting is clearly a significant need that will be at the forefront of any reporting solution If our goal is to discuss this need in detail tomorrow Im all for it I need the education If our goal is to look at progress towards a solution we should look to postpone I take responsibility for distracting efforts in progress but believe the delay worthwhile One final issue Sean the Sensecorp consultant who has been working on the project is in California We may want to wait on his participation I believe we are all on the same page mhf Forwarded by Mark FrankHOUECT on PM Ozlem ES PM To Mark CT cc Subject Re FERC Data Warehouse FYI Forwarded by Ozlem MahmoodHOUEES on PM Melissa NRON AM To David NRON cc Ozlem ES Sheila NRON Subject Re FERC Data Warehouse Why wouldnt we ETS has a specific gap that needs to be addressed and we need to find the best way to fix it I would just be sure not to jump to the DW as the solution unless the ISC has been given ample opportunity to propose a solution Be sure to go that route too David McEllin PM To Melissa NRON cc Ozlem ES Subject Re FERC Data Warehouse Will we be proceeding with the Dec meeting If so Ozlem could you get notice out to the original distribution list concerning time and location I will be out of the office on Monday so I would appreciate your assistance in coordinating the meeting logistics Thanks Forwarded by David McEllinFGTEnron on PM David McEllin PM To Melissa NRON cc Rod NRON James NRON Sheila NRON Mark CT Subject Re FERC Data Warehouse I feel we should proceed with the Dec meeting at least to get a better understanding of what the data warehouse can do for us related to FERC and maybe determine just how far along it currently is The original reason we were asked to meet on this issue is that it was thought that a lot of work had already been completed and it wouldnt take much to deliver an end product The other attendees as well as myself need to understand what this can do for us as opposed to a potential solution in SAP Melissa Becker PM To Rod NRON James NRON cc Sheila NRON Mark CT David NRON Subject Re FERC Data Warehouse I am not sure the statement below from Ozlem is entirely accurate In addtion to Project Sunrise I have asked Sheila Howard who is the lead for the financial team in the ISC to work with the Project Sunrise team to understand what your issues are and help determine a solution Let me assure you that whether through the Project Sunrise or the ISC we are working on your issue and it has NOT dropped off the radar screen As a matter of fact Project Sunrise had a status meeting today and this came up several times I think the only question is whats the best approach for solving it I will leave it to Dave as the ETS representative to Project Sunrise along with Sheila Mark and the others listed below to continue to work on a solution for the FERC problems Dave is there any reason NOT to proceed with the December meeting under these assumptions I would just ask that Sheila be included Thanks Rod Hayslett AM To Melissa NRON cc Subject Re FERC Data Warehouse If there is going to be no effort to fix my problem as a result of the change in the effort I am wondering why I should support the project at all Forwarded by Rod HayslettFGTEnron on AM James Saunders PM To Bob ChandlerET NRON Jennifer NRON Debbie NRON John NRON cc David NRON Rod NRON Subject Re FERC Data Warehouse Do we have any current Form or other FERC related reporting requirementsconcerns as a result of the redirection below Forwarded by James SaundersFGTEnron on PM Ozlem ES PM To David NRON cc Jennifer NRON Debbie NRON Harry WaltersET NRON Hoyt IveyET NRON Bob ChandlerET NRON James NRON Subject Re FERC Data Warehouse Dear FERCinterested representatives Due to the current redirection of the data warehouse project which is now part of Project Sunrise it has been determined that it is best to postpone a FERC discussionanalysis until after the collection of business requirements and final scoping of the project However I will be recommending that a focus group be designated for FERC Thank you for your help and patience and I apologize for the upheaval and postponements Tzlem David NRON PM To Jennifer NRON Debbie NRON Harry WaltersET NRON Hoyt IveyET NRON Bob ChandlerET NRON cc Ozlem ES James NRON Subject FERC Data Warehouse The review by ETS of the FERC data warehouse information will be on Tuesday December th at am location TBA This initial review should last approx one hour and your input would be greatly appreciated I will inform you of the location when this is established Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions

Re FERC Data Warehouse Cc Ozlem to give me a status report on FERC efforts to date Her update may be helpful in determining whether to meet tomorrow It reiterates the value of having Sean OReilly attend mhf Forwarded by Mark FrankHOUECT on PM Ozlem ES AM To Mark CT cc Subject Re FERC Data Warehouse FERC Background When Sensecorp was hired to install the ACTA Rapidmarts Enron requested a FERC Rapidmart which had not yet been defined by ACTA In order to fulfill Enrons requirements Sensecorp hired a FERC expert Sean OReilly to assist us in defining and developing a FERC Rapidmart At the time that Sean structured the Rapidmart he stated that the FERC information did not appear to reconcile with FI appropriately and that some changes in SAP were probably required to ensure that the information was correct Also before Sean left he demonstrated to some Enron business representatives the functionality that would be available in the FERC Rapidmart but that the information would still need to be investigated and appropriately reviewed Project Sunrise At the time that Project Sunrise was initiated and there appeared to be some downtime for the Sensecorp developers I approached Beverly Fennessy to contact FERC business representatives to review the FERC information and determine if it could be used with a few minor changes I was hoping that we might be able to quickly complete something that might be of use to the business We then set up a meeting with the FERC representatives to review the data FERC Review However as myself and Scott Brudner reviewed the information we discovered that we are not FERC experts and all the value that we would be able to provide in a meeting is to demonstrate the tables that were selected and the structure of the data We would not be able to explain FERC how the module worked or what the information meant It seemed that there would not be any true benefit in realizing a meeting to review that information especially since we were aware that problems existed in the SAP FERC module which we would not be able to explain We felt that the only way to have a truly productive meeting and progress in the development of FERC was to have Sean OReilly return and assist us However since Project Sunrise is still in the business requirements gathering phase Beverly thought it was best and I agreed not to charge further development expenses to the project until we were in that phase of the project We thought it was best to investigate and further develop FERC once the project scope had been defined and FERC was included as a priority At that point in time we decided to cancel the meeting and informed the appropriate parties Business Interest As you can tell from the emails below there is renewed interest in reviewing the FERC information and furthering development However Scott and myself will not be able to demonstrate FERC functionality to the business anymore than was already demonstrated to them by Sean in August In order to provide true value we require the assistance of Sean andor a tremendous amount of time to become FERC experts ourselves Neither of these items are feasible by tomorrow morning Please advise how we should proceed Thank you Tzlem Forwarded by Ozlem MahmoodHOUEES on AM David NRON PM To Melissa NRON cc Ozlem ES Subject Re FERC Data Warehouse Will we be proceeding with the Dec meeting If so Ozlem could you get notice out to the original distribution list concerning time and location I will be out of the office on Monday so I would appreciate your assistance in coordinating the meeting logistics Thanks Forwarded by David McEllinFGTEnron on PM David McEllin PM To Melissa NRON cc Rod NRON James NRON Sheila NRON Mark CT Subject Re FERC Data Warehouse I feel we should proceed with the Dec meeting at least to get a better understanding of what the data warehouse can do for us related to FERC and maybe determine just how far along it currently is The original reason we were asked to meet on this issue is that it was thought that a lot of work had already been completed and it wouldnt take much to deliver an end product The other attendees as well as myself need to understand what this can do for us as opposed to a potential solution in SAP Melissa Becker PM To Rod NRON James NRON cc Sheila NRON Mark CT David NRON Subject Re FERC Data Warehouse I am not sure the statement below from Ozlem is entirely accurate In addtion to Project Sunrise I have asked Sheila Howard who is the lead for the financial team in the ISC to work with the Project Sunrise team to understand what your issues are and help determine a solution Let me assure you that whether through the Project Sunrise or the ISC we are working on your issue and it has NOT dropped off the radar screen As a matter of fact Project Sunrise had a status meeting today and this came up several times I think the only question is whats the best approach for solving it I will leave it to Dave as the ETS representative to Project Sunrise along with Sheila Mark and the others listed below to continue to work on a solution for the FERC problems Dave is there any reason NOT to proceed with the December meeting under these assumptions I would just ask that Sheila be included Thanks Rod Hayslett AM To Melissa NRON cc Subject Re FERC Data Warehouse If there is going to be no effort to fix my problem as a result of the change in the effort I am wondering why I should support the project at all Forwarded by Rod HayslettFGTEnron on AM James Saunders PM To Bob ChandlerET NRON Jennifer NRON Debbie NRON John NRON cc David NRON Rod NRON Subject Re FERC Data Warehouse Do we have any current Form or other FERC related reporting requirementsconcerns as a result of the redirection below Forwarded by James SaundersFGTEnron on PM Ozlem ES PM To David NRON cc Jennifer NRON Debbie NRON Harry WaltersET NRON Hoyt IveyET NRON Bob ChandlerET NRON James NRON Subject Re FERC Data Warehouse Dear FERCinterested representatives Due to the current redirection of the data warehouse project which is now part of Project Sunrise it has been determined that it is best to postpone a FERC discussionanalysis until after the collection of business requirements and final scoping of the project However I will be recommending that a focus group be designated for FERC Thank you for your help and patience and I apologize for the upheaval and postponements Tzlem David NRON PM To Jennifer NRON Debbie NRON Harry WaltersET NRON Hoyt IveyET NRON Bob ChandlerET NRON cc Ozlem ES James NRON Subject FERC Data Warehouse The review by ETS of the FERC data warehouse information will be on Tuesday December th at am location TBA This initial review should last approx one hour and your input would be greatly appreciated I will inform you of the location when this is established Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions
